  • 4.II.8E

    #Numbers and Sets
    2001

    What is the Principle of Mathematical Induction? Derive it from the statement that every non-empty set of positive integers has a least element.

    Prove, by induction on nnn, that 9n≡2n( mod 7)9^{n} \equiv 2^{n}(\bmod 7)9n≡2n(mod7) for all n≥1n \geq 1n≥1.

    What is wrong with the following argument?

    "Theorem: ∑i=1ni=n(n+1)/2+126\sum_{i=1}^{n} i=n(n+1) / 2+126∑i=1n​i=n(n+1)/2+126.

    Proof: Assume that m≥1m \geq 1m≥1 and ∑i=1mi=m(m+1)/2+126\sum_{i=1}^{m} i=m(m+1) / 2+126∑i=1m​i=m(m+1)/2+126. Add m+1m+1m+1 to both sides to get

    ∑i=1m+1i=m(m+1)/2+m+1+126=(m+1)(m+2)/2+126\sum_{i=1}^{m+1} i=m(m+1) / 2+m+1+126=(m+1)(m+2) / 2+126 i=1∑m+1​i=m(m+1)/2+m+1+126=(m+1)(m+2)/2+126

    So, by induction, the theorem is proved."
